member.name: T:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Binary.ADBClient
member.summary:
.NET 4.x (Thread-Safe) ADB-Client, to interact with an Android device via the (A)ndroid (D)ebug (B)ridge.
*NOTE*
ALL local and remote paths, special variables, etc. will be set in quotes ("), so there is no need to quote anything.
Exceptions are nested commands, these you have to quote your self.
All functions in this and some sub-classes are designed to work primary without root.
If you want to use all functions with root rights, you have to restart the ADB-Daemon on the device with root rights.
You can restart the ADB-Daemon by using or .
Otherwise, you can set to true and force the usage of (su -c) for the most sub-classes.
This object implements

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Binary.ADBClient.Execute(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Execute a custom command
*NOTE*
timeOut = -1 implies infinite
Command examples:
shell "ls -l /"
push C:\\my\\folder /my/location
pull /my/location C:\\my\\folder
member.param: time the process will wait for output, -1 implies infinite, 0 implies class internal timeout

member.name: F:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Input.AKey.KeyButtonA

member.name: F:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Input.AKey.KeyButtonB
member.summary:
B Button key. On a game controller, the B button should be either the button labeled B or the second button on the bottom row of controller buttons.

member.name: F:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Input.AKey.KeyButtonC
member.summary:

member.name: F:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Input.AKey.KeyButtonL1
member.summary:
L1 Button key. On a game controller, the L1 button should be either the button labeled L1 (or L) or the top left trigger button.
Since SDK 9 (API 9)

member.name: F:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Input.AKey.KeyButtonL2
member.summary:
L2 Button key. On a game controller, the L2 button should be either the button labeled L2 or the bottom left trigger button.
Since SDK 9 (API 9)

member.name: F:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Input.AKey.KeyButtonMode
member.summary:

member.name: F:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Input.AKey.KeyButtonR1
member.summary:

Since SDK 9 (API 9)

member.name: F:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Input.AKey.KeyButtonR2
member.summary:

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.IO.AFileSystemInfo.Chmod(System.String)
member.summary:
Sets the given chmod for this element on the device.
*NOTE*
You can also set an unix chmod (rwxrwxrwx). If you want to set an unix format, you must use the full 9 chars.
Like this examples: (rw-rwx-wt), (rwsrwsrwt), (rw-r--r--)
*HINT*
Usefull if you want to copy some permissions to other files/folders.
This function uses to convert the unix format to an number.

member.summary:
Un-mount the mont point.

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.IO.AMountPointInfo.ParseSize(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Parse the given string to an long based on bytes
*NOTE*
This parser will check for common df endings like: K,M,G,T,P,E,Z,Y and calculate the byte size based on 1000 or 1024
If none of the mentioned endings are found, the method will use 1000 or 1024 depending on , to calculate the byte size.
member.param: if True, 1024 will be use to calculate a unit, otherwise 1000 is used

member.name: T:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.IO.MediaScanner
member.summary:
Manage the Android MediaScanner
*NOTE*
This class gives u access to the "MediaScanner", so u can update the Android system, manually, after file interactions.
This is needed if u, for example transfer files via ADB push to any "Media" storage. Because, the files aren't visible on MTP/PTP nor in some "Media Storage" related apps.

member.name: T:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.IO.Mount
member.summary:
Mount is the general class to un-/mount the filesystem or parts of it, on the device.
*NOTE* This class needs root access on the device

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.IO.Mount.IsRootRW
member.summary: IsRootRW checks if rootfs and /system is mounted as read/write or not.

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.IO.Mount.IsReadWrite(System.String)
member.summary: IsReadWrite checks if the given id is mounted as read/write or not.
member.param: id to mount e.g. rootfs or /system

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.IO.Mount.Loop(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Mount the given source path as loop device to the given destination
*NOTE*
The device kernel MUST support loop devices!
If the method return false u can try it with ADB.Instance().UseBusyBox = true, if busybox exists.
If u get then also a false u have to mount the loop device by ur self. Reason for this could be a wrong loop device location...
I got this problem on my device. losetup returned the location /dev/loop1 but it was /dev/block/loop1.
This method REQUIRES root access.
member.param: mount location, the path must already exist

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.IO.Mount.ReadOnly(System.String)
member.summary:
ReadOnly try to remount the given id as read/only.
This method REQUIRES root access.
member.param: id to remount e.g. rootfs or /system

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.IO.Mount.ReadWrite(System.String)
member.summary: ReadWrite try to remount the given id as read/write
member.param: id to remount e.g. rootfs or /system

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.IO.Mount.RootRO
member.summary:
RootRO try to remount rootfs and /system as read/only.
This method REQUIRES root access.

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.IO.Mount.RootRW
member.summary:
RootRW try to remount rootfs and /system as read/write.
This method REQUIRES root access.

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.IO.Mount.UnMount(System.String)
member.summary:
Un-mount the mont point.
This method tries to un-mount the with "umount". If this doesn't work or "umount" doesn't exists, it will do another attempt with "unmount".
This method REQUIRES root access.
member.param: id to unmount e.g. rootfs or /system

member.name: T:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.IO.UPath
member.summary: Unix Path class

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.IO.UPath.AdjustFile(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
AdjustFilePath adds a (/) to the begin if no1 exist and remove it on the end if 1 exist, also it will replace "//", "/\s{1,}/" to "/"
*NOTE*
Quotes are only added if whitespaces are detected!
If a (') is detected, the quotes will automatically switch to (")

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.IO.UPath.AdjustDirectory(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
AdjustDirectoryPath adds a (/) to the given path begin and end if no1 exists, also it will replace "//", "/\s{1,}/" to "/"
*NOTE*
Quotes are only added if whitespaces are detected!
If a (') is detected, the quotes will automatically switch to (")

Extracts the directory of the last element (file/directory).

/ = /
/system/bin/ = /system/
/system/bin/file = /system/bin/

member.summary:
Extracts the name of the last element (file/directory).

This method will return an empty string if the path is "/".

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.IO.UPath.GetUniqueDirectory(System.String)
member.summary:
Returns an unique (sub) directory path based on the given directory
*NOTE*
There will be no directory created (!) it's only a string. The names are similar to: /my/prefix/38Ejt-m6GrX8/, /my/prefix/UPGaFop_pzqB/, /my/prefix/iVNxOYgCUY3m/, /my/prefix/5gaNzKia0roj/, /my/prefix/SFu59eaFPwmZ/

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.IO.UPath.GetUniqueFile(System.String)
member.summary:
Returns an unique file path based on the given directory
*NOTE*
There will be no file created (!) it's only a string. The names are similar to: /my/prefix/38Ejt-m6GrX8.rnd, /my/prefix/UPGaFop_pzqB.rnd, /my/prefix/iVNxOYgCUY3m.rnd, /my/prefix/5gaNzKia0roj.rnd, /my/prefix/SFu59eaFPwmZ.rnd

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.IO.UPath.MaxLength
member.summary: Max path length

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.IO.UPath.NormalizePath(System.String)
member.summary:
Removes invalid MS-Windows path chars like: ?, *, :, <, >, |
*NOTE*
A "." at the end will also be removed
After all replacements are done, is used to remove leading/trailing whitespaces

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.IO.UPath.Quote(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Quote adds quotes (') or (") to a string.
mode 1 = (') | 2 = (")
If a (') is detected, the quotes will automatically switch to (").

member.name: T:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Provider.Provider
member.summary: This is the main class to interact with the device "Provider" such as contacts, sms, etc.

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Provider.Provider.Contacts
member.summary: Returns and if not exist, creates the Contacts instance

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Provider.Provider.Telephony
member.summary: Returns and if not exist, creates the Telephony instance

member.name: T:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Provider.Telephony
member.summary:
This is the main class to interact with the device telephony provider database
*NOTE* This class needs min. 6 sec. to load the needed tables from the mmssms.db on the device.
*NOTE* If the device is via W-Lan/Lan connected, it can take up to 12 sec. to load the needed tables.
*HINT* If u can't load the data from the device u can try to change the "TimeOut".
*NOTE* This class require root access!

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Provider.Telephony.DatabasePathSmsMms
member.summary:
Get/Set the remote sms/mms database path
*NOTE* The default path is "/data/data/com.android.providers.telephony/databases/mmssms.db"

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Provider.Telephony.IsInitialized
member.summary: Return true if all needed tables are successfully stored in it's tmp vars, otherwise it will return false.

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Provider.Telephony.Timeout
member.summary:
Set the response timeout in milliseconds, the default value is 500
*NOTE* This timeout defines the maximum wait time for an line of output

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Provider.Telephony.GetParts
member.summary: Returns the complete part table.

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Provider.Telephony.GetSms
member.summary: Returns the complete sms table.

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Provider.Telephony.GetSmsByPhoneNumber(System.String)
member.summary: Return all sms from/to the given adress (phone number).

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Provider.Telephony.GetSmsByRawContactID(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return all sms from/to the given person (raw_contact_id).

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Provider.Telephony.GetSmsByRawContactID(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32})
member.summary: Return all sms from/to the given persons (raw_contact_ids).

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Provider.Telephony.GetSmsByThreadID(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return all sms from/to the given thread_id.

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Provider.Telephony.GetThreads
member.summary: Returns the complete threads table.

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Provider.Telephony.LoadData
member.summary:
Loads the needed tables in it's tmp vars.
*NOTE* U need to call this method ONLY if "IsInitialized" is false
*NOTE* If "IsInitialized" is still false after manually call this method pls report this issue.
*REPORT VIA* http://forum.xda-developers.com/showthread.php?t=2772502
*REPORT VIA* webmaster@sebastiangrinke.info

member.name: T:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Provider.Contacts

This class require root access!

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Shell.Shell.CheckResizeBug
member.summary:
Checks for an known issue on CM/Lineage roms.
The problem is that those roms send and "resize" (ESC 7 ESC [r ESC [999;999H ESC [6n ESC 8) request to the user. This ends in an unresponsive shell...
To avoid this situation we send 0x20 (space) to the device before we accept any input.

member.name: T:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite.Options
member.summary:
This class is designed to define the needed sqlite3 options
*NOTE* This class can only be used if u have an "Open()" connection! U can check this with the "IsOpen" parameter.

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite.Options.Bail
member.summary: .bail (Stop after hitting an error. Default OFF)

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite.Options.Echo
member.summary: .echo (Turn command echo on or off)

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite.Options.Explain
member.summary: .explain (Turn output mode suitable for EXPLAIN on or off.)

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite.Options.Header
member.summary: .header (Turn display of headers on or off.)

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite.Options.Mode
member.summary:
.mode (Set output mode where Mode is one of:)
csv (Comma-separated values)
column (Left-aligned columns. (See .width))
html (HTML code)
insert (SQL insert statements for TABLE)
line (One value per line)
list (Values delimited by .separator string)
tabs (Tab-separated values)
tcl (TCL list elements)

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite.Options.NullValue
member.summary: .nullvalue (Print STRING in place of NULL values)

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite.Options.Output
member.summary: .output ("stdout" Send output to the commandline. | "/path/to/ur/file" Send the output to the give file.)

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite.Options.Separator
member.summary: .separator (Change separator used by output mode and .import)

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite.Options.Stats
member.summary: .stats (Turn stats on or off)

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite.Options.Timer
member.summary: .timer (Turn the CPU timer measurement on or off)

This class give u access to some basic sql tools
*NOTE* This class is a helper class to build an sql query.

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite.QueryTools.Quote(System.String)
member.summary: Quote

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite.QueryTools.Replace(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Replace the field-output in "field", search for "s" and replace with "r"
member.param: if true "s" and "r" will be set in single-quotes (')

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite.QueryTools.ReplaceNL(System.String)
member.summary: Replace "\r" with "<_R_>" and "\n" with "<_N_>"

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite.QueryTools.ReplaceNL(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Replace "\r" with the given "r" string and "\n" with the given "n" string.

member.name: T:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite.SQLite3
member.summary:
This is the main class to interact with the device internal SQLite3
*NOTE*
sqlite must be already installed on the device!

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite.SQLite3.Dispose
member.summary: IDisposable

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite.SQLite3.CmdTimeout
member.summary:
Set the response timeout in milliseconds, the default value is 500
*NOTE* This timeout defines the maximum wait time for an line of output
*NOTE* This value can only be set if there is no command in progress!
*HINT* U can check this with IsDone

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite.SQLite3.Exists
member.summary: Checks if SQLite3 is installed. If so, it will return true otherwise it returns false

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite.SQLite3.IsDone
member.summary: Return true if the last command is done otherwise it will return false

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite.SQLite3.IsOpen
member.summary: Returns true if the database connection is established otherwise it returns false

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite.SQLite3.LastError
member.summary: Returns the last error

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite.SQLite3.PATH_SQLITE3
member.summary:
Set/Get the (full/physical) remote sqlite3 path
*NOTE* Switch this property ONLY if sqlite3 is NOT installed and placed somewhere on the device!

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite.SQLite3.UseSu
member.summary:
Set to true if u want to use sqlite3 with su rights
*NOTE* This value can only be set if no connection is established!

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite.SQLite3.Version
member.summary: Returns the SQLite3 version number or "string.Empty"

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite.SQLite3.Cancel
member.summary:
Cancel the current operation
*NOTE* This method reopens the database! Because we can't "cancel" an executed command, we have to close the current sqlite3 shell instance and start a new one.

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite.SQLite3.Close
member.summary: Close the database connection

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite.SQLite3.CreateKeyArrayFromLine(System.String[],System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates an Key-Array from the given data

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite.SQLite3.CreateKeyArrayFromLine(System.String[],System.String[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates an Key-Array from the given data

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite.SQLite3.CreateKeyArrayFromQuery(System.String[])
member.summary:
Creates an List<Dictionary<string, string>> from the given query data
*NOTE* This query is auto-terminated with an ";"
*NOTE* U can send an single string query like "SELECT * FROM somewhere"
*NOTE* Or u can build an query like ("SELECT", "*", "FROM", "somewhere")
*WARNING* Use "X'0D'" and "X'0A'" instead of "\r" and "\n" in ur requests! If u can't avoid an request with "\r" or "\n", use Execute() and parse the output ur self.
*HINT* U can use QueryTools.ReplaceNL() to replace "\r" and "\n"

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite.SQLite3.CreateKeyArrayFromQuery(System.Boolean,System.String[])
member.summary:
Creates an List<Dictionary<string, string>> from the given query data
*NOTE* This query is auto-terminated with an ";"
*NOTE* U can send an single string query like "SELECT * FROM somewhere"
*NOTE* Or u can build an query like ("SELECT", "*", "FROM", "somewhere")
*WARNING* Use "X'0D'" and "X'0A'" instead of "\r" and "\n" in ur requests! If u can't avoid an request with "\r" or "\n", use Execute() and parse the output ur self.
*HINT* U can use QueryTools.ReplaceNL() to replace "\r" and "\n"

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite.SQLite3.CreateKeyArrayFromQuery(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary:
Creates an List<Dictionary<string, string>> from the given output
*NOTE* "rawData" must be created with ".header ON" output (Options.Header = true) otherwise this method will fail!
*IMPORTENT* The 1st line in the List<string> must be the table headers!
member.param: For example the return from ExecuteQuery()

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite.SQLite3.CreateKeyArrayFromQuery(System.Boolean,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary:
Creates an List<Dictionary<string, string>> from the given output
*NOTE* "rawData" must be created with ".header ON" output (Options.Header = true) otherwise this method will fail!
*IMPORTENT* The 1st line in the List<string> must be the table headers!
member.param: For example the return from ExecuteQuery()

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite.SQLite3.Execute(System.String)
member.summary:
Execute ur own sqlite3 command
*NOTE* Remember if u send an SQL-query terminate it with an ";" or simply use Query()

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.SQLite.SQLite3.ExecuteQuery(System.String[])
member.summary:
Send the given SQL-query to the device
*NOTE* This query is auto-terminated with an ";"
*NOTE* U can send an single string query like "SELECT * FROM somewhere"
*NOTE* Or u can build an query like ("SELECT", "*", "FROM", "somewhere")
*WARNING* Use "X'0D'" and "X'0A'" instead of "\r" and "\n" in ur requests! If u can't avoid an request with "\r" or "\n", use Execute() and parse the output ur self.
*HINT* U can use QueryTools.ReplaceNL() to replace "\r" and "\n"
*REASON* This function will cut the 1st line of output to guarantee that u only get the requested output, without the query-command u send.
*REASON* In addition, this feature is really relevant for internal needs.

member.summary: Opens the remote DB for interaction

member.summary: Returns and if not exist, creates the Options instance

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Phone.SendSMS(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Send the given text as SMS from the device to the given number
*NOTE*
This will only work if the display is on and NOT locked or if the display is off and NOT locked.
If the device is locked, this function will sometimes freeze the current thread until its unlocked.
member.param: Text to send *NOTE* 160 signs are 1 SMS

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Phone.FormatNumber(System.String)
member.summary: Formats the given number. Will remove whitespaces, "-", "(" and ")", also the "#" gets replaced by "%23".

member.summary: Check if adbd have root rights on the device

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Daemon.PATH_ADBD
member.summary:
Set/Get the (full/physical) remote busybox path
*NOTE*
Switch this property ONLY if adbd is NOT inside the given path!

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Daemon.Restart(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Restart adbd on the device
*NOTE*
If port is empty or 0, NO port value will be set to the device. If port is -1 the device will restart in USB mode.
member.param: restarts the adbd on the given port

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Daemon.Root
member.summary: Restart adbd with root permissions on the device

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Daemon.Stop
member.summary:
Stop adbd on the device
*NOTE*
After a call to this function adb is no longer available and u need to manually restart the daemon on the device.

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Daemon.UnRoot
member.summary: Restart adbd without root permissions on the device

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Daemon.AddBuildPropEntries
member.summary:
Adds "ro.adb.secure=1", "service.adb.root=0" and "service.adb.tcp.port=-1" to the "/system/build.prop" so that adbd is able to start in root mode
*NOTE*
This may not work on stock roms!

member.name: T:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Su
member.summary:
Su is the general class to interact with su rights on the device.
*NOTE*
If the device is in state, the enforcement of "su -c" will stop, until the device is back in state.

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Su.Exists
member.summary: Checks if su is installed and working

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Su.Version
member.summary:
Version return the current su version number (if supported)
*NOTE*
If the version can not be determined, su is not found or not accessable, the return is string.Empty.

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Device.Su.SingleArgument
member.summary:
Enables an WorkAround for older SU binaries, which needs the command as an single argument.
For example, the latest SU binaries support a syntax like [su -c id -u] where older binaries need [su -c "id -u"].
If u deactivate this workaround by enabled , gets also disabled!
This workaround is by default disabled.
Affected Methods:
, , ,
, , ,

member.summary: Gets a value that indicates if ADB is running as root.

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Shares.ADBClientBase.UseBusyBox
member.summary:
Get/Set if BusyBox is used by default in some of the sub-classes.
If no BusyBox is installed on the device, this property can't be changed and will always return false.

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Shares.ADBClientBase.UseSu
member.summary:
Get/Set if (su -c CMD_TO_EXECUE) is used by default in some of the sub-classes.
If su is not installed on the device, this property can't be changed and will always return false.
This property will not affect the ADB base class, but the most sub-classes that interact with the shell. Except those which needs root to interact with the device.

member.name: T:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Sockets.ADBClient
member.summary:
.NET 4.x (Thread-Safe) ADB-Client, to interact with an Android device via the (A)ndroid (D)ebug (B)ridge - Protocol.
*WARNING*
This ADB-Client is ONLY for IP based devices! For USB devices, please use .
This client includes currently not all what can offer. (8 calls are missing) So read the comments and check them for a "NOT-Implemented" mark.
*NOTE*
ALL local and remote paths, special variables, etc. will be set in quotes ("), so there is no need to quote anything.
Exceptions are nested commands, these you have to quote your self.
All functions in this and some sub-classes are designed to work primary without root.
If you want to use all functions with root rights, you have to restart the ADB-Daemon on the device with root rights.
You can restart the ADB-Daemon by using or .
Otherwise, you can set to true and force the usage of (su -c) for the most sub-classes.
This object implements

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.Sockets.ADBSocket.ChunkSize
member.summary:
Get/Set the chunk size
*NOTE*
The given size gets ALWAYS decreased by 24 (packet header)
Default is 256kb, older clients may have 4096 byte hardcoded. This class will switch in that case to 4096 byte chunks.
This property can only be changed if is false!

member.name: T:AndroidCtrl.ADB.IADBClient
member.summary:
interface.
Represents the ADB-Client for & .
ALL local and remote paths, special variables, etc. will be set in quotes ("), so there is no need to quote anything.
Exceptions are nested commands, these you have to quote your self.
All functions in this and some sub-classes are designed to work primary without root.
If you want to use all functions with root rights, you have to restart the ADB-Daemon on the device with root rights.
You can restart the ADB-Daemon by using or .
Otherwise, you can set to true and force the usage of (su -c) for the most sub-classes.
Implements

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.IADBClient.CmdTimeout
member.summary:
Get/Set the default timeout in milliseconds that a process waits before it ends.
The default is "-1", it implies infinite.

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.IADBClient.ID
member.summary: Gets the ID (serial/ip:port) of the assigned device.

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.IADBClient.LastState
member.summary: Gets the last known device state e.g. DEVICE/RECOVERY/OFFLINE etc.

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.IADBClient.IsBooted
member.summary:
Gets a value that indicates whether the device has booted or not.
This will return true when android finished the complete boot procedure.

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.IADBClient.IsRoot
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates if ADB is running as root.

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.IADBClient.UseBusyBox
member.summary:
Get/Set if BusyBox is used by default in some of the sub-classes.
If no BusyBox is installed on the device, this property can't be changed and will always return false.

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.ADB.IADBClient.UseSu
member.summary:
Get/Set if (su -c CMD_TO_EXECUE) is used by default in some of the sub-classes.
If su is not installed on the device, this property can't be changed and will always return false.
This property will not affect the ADB base class, but the most sub-classes that interact with the shell. Except those which needs root to interact with the device.

member.name: T:AndroidCtrl.Fastboot.IFastbootClient
member.summary:
.NET 4.x (Thread-Safe) wrapper class, to interact with an Android device via Fastboot.
*NOTE*
ALL local and remote paths, special variables, etc. will be set in quotes ("), so there is no need to quote anything.
Exceptions are nested commands, these u have to quote ur self.

member.name: P:AndroidCtrl.Fastboot.IFastbootClient.CmdTimeout
member.summary:
CmdTimeout define for the whole instance how long Xecute() will wait for the given process to responde.
*NOTE*
Instance default is "-1", it implies infinite
The value are milliseconds 30 sec = 30 000 ms

member.name: T:AndroidCtrl.Tools.IMEI
member.summary: (I)nternational(M)obile(E)quipment(I)dentifier - Tools

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.Tools.IMEI.BuildFromPartsV1(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Constructs a syntactical valid IMEI based on the given parts:
(T)ype (A)llocation (C)ode = 6 digits (e.g.: 012345)
(F)inal (A)ssembly (C)ode = 2 digits (e.g: 01)
(S)erial (N)umber = 6 digits (e.g.: 012345)
(optional) (S)oftware (V)ersion (N)umber = 2 digits (e.g.: 01)
*Side Note*
Takes an input, based on the scheme applied before April 1st, 2004

member.name: M:AndroidCtrl.Tools.IMEI.BuildFromPartsV2(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Constructs a syntactical valid IMEI based on the given parts:
(R)eporting (B)ody (I)dentifier = 2 digits (e.g.: 01)
(T)ype (A)llocation (C)ode = 6 digits (e.g.: 012345)
(S)erial (N)umber = 6 digits (e.g.: 012345)
(optional) (S)oftware (V)ersion (N)umber = 2 digits (e.g.: 01)
*Side Note*
Takes an input, based on the scheme applied since April 1st, 2004

member.summary: Calculates the checksum of the given IMEI
member.param: IMEI as - at least 14 digits long

member.summary: Matches a calculated checksum (of the 1st, 14 digits) against the IMEI checksum (15th digit)

member.name: T:AndroidCtrl.Signer.Signer
member.summary:
.NET 4.x (Thread-Safe) wrapper class, to interact with the signapk.jar.
*NOTE*
ALL local and remote paths, special variables, etc. will be set in quotes ("), so there is no need to quote anything.
Exceptions are nested commands, these u have to quote ur self.
Until JavaExists returns false, all calls inside this class and all subclasses will not work!
If u call any method until JavaExists returns false, u'll get no exceptions! Coz, ExecuteBG() checks if the given
(.exe) file exists, if not, it will return an empty List string. So if the (.exe) not exists no call will be executed!

CmdTimeout define for the whole instance how long Xecute() will wait for the given process to responde.
*NOTE*
Instance default is "-1", it implies infinite
The value are milliseconds 30 sec = 30 000 ms

Execute a custom command

time the process will wait for output, -1 implies infinite, 0 implies class internal timeout

member.summary:
Signs an apk or zip file with the given public and private keys

*NOTE* The signed file will end like xxxxx_signed.apk or xxxxx_signed.zip

*NOTE* The signed file will end like xxxxx_signed.apk or xxxxx_signed.zip
